actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Social Security Act to make certain that recipients of supplemental security income benefits, recipients of aid or assistance under the various Federal- State public assistance and medicaid programs, and recipients of assistance or benefits under the veterans' pension and compensation programs and certain other Federal and federally assisted programs will not have the amount of such benefits, aid, or assistance reduced because of post-1973 increases in monthly social security benefits.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends Title IV (Aid to Families with Dependent Children) and Title XVI (Supplemental Security Income for the Aged, Blind, and Disabled) of the Social Security Act, and the law relating to veterans' pensions to provide that recipients of supplemental security income benefits, recipients of aid or assistance under the veterans' pension and compensation program and specified other Federal and federally assisted programs including the food stamp program and the public housing program, will not have the amount of such benefits, aid, or assistance reduced because of post-1973 increases in monthly social security benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Social Security Act to make certain that recipients of supplemental security income benefits, recipients of aid or assistance under the various Federal- State public assistance and medicaid programs, and recipients of assistance or benefits under the veterans' pension and compensation programs and certain other Federal and federally assisted programs will not have the amount of such benefits, aid, or assistance reduced because of post-1973 increases in monthly social security benefits.
